titleStmt.title: Whereas both Houses of Parliament have appointed certaine ships to bee set forth this spring for guard of the narrow seas, preservation of trade and for the necessary defence of this kingdome & other His Majesties dominions which at this time is of great necessity ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: At head of page: Die Veneris 21 February, 1644.
"Ordered by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament that this ordinance bee forthwith printed and published. Jo. Browne Cleric. Parliamentorum."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
